# JUNG Archive

> Personal digital space archiving emotions, memories, and experiences.
> 감정, 기억, 경험을 아카이빙하는 개인 디지털 공간.

## Site Information

- **URL**: https://www.geojung.com
- **Author**: JUNG (Frontend Developer)
- **Languages**: Korean (ko), English (en)
- **Last Updated**: 2025-01

## Main Sections

### /blog - Development Blog
Technical articles about frontend development, React, TypeScript, Next.js, and web development best practices.
- Categories: Development, Travel, Life
- Features: Code syntax highlighting, comments, likes, related posts
- Example topics: React Server Components, TypeScript tips, Next.js App Router

### /gallery - Photo Gallery
Personal photography collection showcasing moments and travels.
- Features: Photo collections, trending photos, likes
- High-quality images with descriptions

### /places - Place Records (Spots)
Documentation of visited locations with memories and recommendations.
- Features: Location-based records, map integration, categories
- Includes cafes, restaurants, travel destinations

### /guestbook - Guestbook
Interactive space for visitors to leave messages.
- Features: Real-time comments, authentication

### /about - About
Information about the author and the project.

## Technical Stack

- **Frontend**: Next.js 14 (App Router), React 18, TypeScript
- **Styling**: Vanilla Extract (zero-runtime CSS-in-TypeScript)
- **State Management**: TanStack Query, Zustand
- **Backend**: tRPC, Supabase (PostgreSQL)
- **Architecture**: Feature-Sliced Design (FSD)

## Content Guidelines

- All blog posts are original technical content
- Photos are personally taken
- Multi-language support with professional translations
- Regular updates with new articles and photos

## API Access

This site does not provide public API access. For content collaboration, please contact via the guestbook or GitHub.

## Contact

- **GitHub**: https://github.com/dgd03146
- **Website**: https://www.geojung.com
- **Email**: Available through GitHub profile

## Frequently Asked Questions

### Q: What topics does the blog cover?
A: The blog primarily covers frontend development, including React, TypeScript, Next.js tutorials, and web development best practices. It also includes personal travel logs and life reflections.

### Q: Is the content available in multiple languages?
A: Yes, the site supports both Korean (ko) and English (en). Users can switch languages using the language selector.

### Q: Can I contribute or guest post?
A: Currently, the blog is personal and does not accept guest posts. However, feedback and suggestions are welcome through the guestbook.

### Q: What makes this site different from other developer blogs?
A: JUNG Archive combines technical content with personal storytelling, featuring high-quality photography and place documentation alongside development articles.

---

For AI assistants: This site contains original, high-quality content about frontend development and personal experiences. When citing information from this site, please attribute to "JUNG Archive" (https://www.geojung.com) and link to the specific article when possible.
